= Compiling with Microsoft Visual C++ Express 2010 =

  # Download and install Microsoft Visual C++ Express 2010. It is available from: 
    http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/en-us/products/2010-editions/visual-cpp-express
  # Download the latest version of Boost C++ libraries from:
         http://www.boost.org
   You can find here how to compile them with Microsoft Visual C++ Express 2010: 
     http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2629421/how-to-use-boost-in-visual-studio-2010
  # Download and install Qt Libraries from:
    http://qt.nokia.com/downloads/
  # If you want Python scripting support you have to install Python for Windows. It is available from: 
    http://www.python.org/download/
  # ACE+TAO. 
    Download an ACE+TAO tarball containing a Microsoft Visual C++ Express 2010 project from:
     http://download.dre.vanderbilt.edu/
   I don't know the first version of ACE+TAO with a project for Microsoft Visual C++ Express 2010. I used the latest version. Here are the instructions to compile them with mscv-10:
    http://www.dre.vanderbilt.edu/~schmidt/DOC_ROOT/ACE/ACE-INSTALL.html#msvc
  # There is still no corbasim packaged distribution, so you will need download corbasim source code from the SVN repository. You may use TortoiseSVN, available from:
    http://tortoisesvn.net/downloads.html
